thread.title: Care nurse charged for forcibly lap-dancing on 100-year-old man | Metro News
thread.title_full: Care nurse charged for forcibly lap-dancing on 100-year-old man | Metro News

author: Richard Hartley-Parkinson For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Care nurse charged for forcibly lap-dancing on 100-year-old man | Metro News
text:
Richard Hartley-Parkinson for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 7:12 am Brittany Fultz has been charged (Picture: Erie County Jail via AP) 
A woman has been charged after she performed a lapdance on a 100-year-old resident at the carehome where she works. 
Brittany Fultz denies gross sexual imposition saying that it was a prank to make him feel good and that he could have told her to stop at any time but didn’t. 
The man has dementia. Donald Trump revokes Obama policy that affected transgender students 
Police said she showed her breasts and buttocks while she danced in front of and on the man in December. 
‘The man knew exactly what was going on and had no problem whatsoever with it,’ defence attorney Geoffrey Oglesby said yesterday. 
Police said the caretaker who recorded Fultz later showed the video to a supervisor, who reported it to police this month. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
The second caretaker wasn’t charged. 
The director of the assisted living center said Fultz, of Marblehead, was fired and the other caretaker also no longer works at the facility. 
The most recent annual state inspection report of the center shows no citations, according to Ohio Department of Aging records. More
